Data: 1.15pm Afternoon, all. We're 45 minutes from the toss in Hobart, where Australia are taking on Scotland. It's one last opportunity for Scotland to pick up their first World Cup win, and one last opportunity for a few of Australia's players to find some form and momentum ahead of the quarterfinals.
Starc to Coetzer, no run starts with a bouncer and the batsman ducks under it.
Starc to Coetzer, no run back of a length with a bit of width outside off. Coetzer throws his bat at it, away from his body, doesn't connect
Starc to Coetzer, no run back of a length on off stump, punched back firmly to the bowler
Starc to Coetzer, no run yorker on leg stump, and Coetzer nearly falls over as he lifts his feet out of the way and digs it out towards square leg
Starc to Coetzer, no run length ball outside off, and he's beaten for pace and angle, once again lashing out without any foot movement
Starc to Coetzer, no run back of a length on middle stump, hops up and defends back to the bowler
Cummins to MacLeod, no run full-toss close to off stump, punched back to the bowler
Cummins to MacLeod, no run length ball, lots of width outside off. Gets forward and slaps it powerfully but straight to Smith at backward point
Cummins to MacLeod, no run off-stump yorker, blocked back to the bowler
Cummins to MacLeod, no run length ball outside off, goes for a flat-bat slap through the off-side and under-edges it, on the bounce, to the keeper
Cummins to MacLeod, FOUR runs this one's shorter and MacLeod can stand up tall and slap it away with a roll of the wrists to the cover point boundary
Cummins to MacLeod, FOUR runs and again, even shorter this time, and he gets on top of the bounce and dismisses it in front of square
Starc to Coetzer, no run length ball outside off, angling away. Coetzer goes for the on-the-up punch, again zero footwork, and again he's beaten
Starc to Coetzer, no run length ball on off stump, punched back to the bowler
Starc to Coetzer, no run edged, drops short of third slip. Full outside off and again Coetzer pushes at it with no feet. Thick edge, but it doesn't carry through to the crouching Smith
Starc to Coetzer, no run now the bouncer, Coetzer ducks safely underneath

Starc to Coetzer, OUT gone! This time it was just back of a length and close enough to off stump for the leaden-footed Coetzer to edge rather than miss as he aimed a massive back-foot punch, looking to go through the covers. Flies to Smith at shoulder height, and he takes it easily
Starc to Machan, 1 run greets him with a yorker, a bit of shape into the left-hander. He stayed nice and still, with a low backlift, and jabbed it away into the off side to deny Starc another maiden

Cummins to Machan, 1 run length ball on middle stump, a bit of swerve away towards off stump. Machan looks to clip it through the leg side, and pops it in the air off the leading edge, well out of reach of Maxwell at square leg
Cummins to MacLeod, FOUR runs full and wide and MacLeod gets down on one knee and plays a good-looking square drive through point
Cummins to MacLeod, no run back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
Cummins to MacLeod, no run full on off stump, driven firmly back to the bowler
Cummins to MacLeod, FOUR runs full and wide once more and this time MacLeod simply lashes at it, with no intention of keeping the ball down, and carves it away over cover point
Cummins to MacLeod, no run short ball now, MacLeod ducks under and it slants away down the leg side
Starc to Machan, 2 runs back of a length, angling into the body, tucked away off the hips towards long leg
Starc to Machan, no run length ball on off and middle, defended to mid-on
Starc to Machan, FOUR runs length ball outside off, and that is excellent timing, just angles his bat and punches away from his body to send it running away through point
Starc to Machan, 1 wide back of a length again, angled too far down the leg side
Starc to Machan, no run short ball, rising to throat height, and he jumps and pops it in the air off the splice of the bat, but there's no short leg
Starc to Machan, no run lbw appeal, not given, not reviewed. It was very full, and it swung in and pinged his front pad in front of middle stump. Was there a tiny inside edge on it?
Starc to Machan, no run shortish now, angling into the body, hops across to defend into the on side
Watson to MacLeod, no run back of a length on off stump, chopped down to backward point
Watson to MacLeod, no run shortish again, and again he rises to his full height and slaps it firmly, but again he can't beat the backward point fielder
Watson to MacLeod, 1 run length ball on off stump, stabbed away to the left of the diving backward point fielder, down to third man
Watson to Machan, no run back of a length on off stump, defended to mid-on
Watson to Machan, FOUR runs full, floated across towards off stump, and Machan just stands there and punches it hard down the ground, between the bowler and mid-on
Watson to Machan, no run back of a length on off stump, defended to short extra cover

Starc to MacLeod, FOUR runs yorker on leg stump, and that is very nicely done by MacLeod. Stayed nice and still, waited for it to come to him, and moved his front leg out of the way to clip it away crisply through backward square leg
Starc to MacLeod, 1 run back of a length outside off, dabbed down to third man
Starc to Machan, 1 run back of a length on middle and leg, hops across to tuck it away towards midwicket
Starc to MacLeod, no run length ball on middle and leg, can't connect with the flick and it strikes him on the thigh pad
Starc to MacLeod, no run good short ball, rising steeply over off stump. MacLeod drops his hands well and leans his upper body out of the way

Starc to MacLeod, OUT ouch. That was short, with a little bit of width on it, and MacLeod has played the cut fairly well, but this one he pops into the air, and straight into the hands of backward point
Watson to Machan, 1 run back of a length outside off, steered down to third man
Watson to Mommsen, no run length ball on off stump, presses forward to block to short cover

Watson to Mommsen, OUT excellent bouncer from Watson, and Mommsen goes second ball. Has to drag the pull from over his right shoulder, and he could only top-edge it to Starc stationed at backward square leg
Watson to Machan, no run back of a length outside off, punched towards short cover
Watson to Machan, 2 runs another well-directed bouncer, angling across Machan, but he manages to get on top of it and hook it down towards long leg
Watson to Machan, FOUR runs length ball angling away from off stump, and Machan goes after it, away from his body, and doesn't quite middle it, but places it pretty well over extra cover
Johnson to Coleman, no run back of a length, angling across. Coleman plays and misses, and then moves his bat inside the line to make it look as if he was leaving it
Johnson to Coleman, no run length ball on off stump, gets behind the line to squeeze it away towards backward point
Johnson to Coleman, no run back of a length outside off, punched crisply to backward point
Johnson to Coleman, no run back of a length on leg stump, tucked away towards short midwicket
Johnson to Coleman, no run short, well-directed, rising over middle stump. Coleman sways away nicely, keeping his eyes on the ball and his hands close to his body
Johnson to Coleman, no run back of a length on off stump, punched to short extra cover
Watson to Machan, no run back of a length on off stump, blocked into the off side
Watson to Machan, 2 runs short on off stump, and he pulls it away towards deep backward square leg

Watson to Machan, FOUR runs length ball on off stump, and that's a nice shot from Machan, simply extends the follow-through of what's a fairly orthodox straight drive, hitting on the up and over mid-on, one bounce and into the boundary
Watson to Machan, no run back of a length on leg stump, blocked towards short midwicket
Watson to Machan, no run back of a length on a fourth-stump line, defended to short extra cover
Watson to Machan, no run back of a length on off stump, punched to mid-off
Cummins to Leask, no run short outside off. Leask swings and misses, looking for the pull
Cummins to Leask, FOUR runs short and wide and that is powerful from Leask. Makes himself just a bit of room by clearing his front leg, and flat-bats it away through cover

Cummins to Leask, FOUR runs once again short and wide, and that's another boundary in the same area. It just sat up, and this time he made a bit more room and rolled his wrists over at the top of the bounce
Cummins to Leask, FOUR runs overpitched outside off and that's three in a row. Stays inside the line and jabs it away through cover point
Cummins to Leask, no run a bit straighter now, almost in the blockhole. Makes room and stabs it to point
Cummins to Leask, no run dug in short now, outside off. Leask goes for the pull and doesn't connect
Faulkner to Davey, no run fullish on off stump, presses forward to block down the ground
Faulkner to Davey, 1 wide bouncer, Davey gets into a low crouch under it

Faulkner to Davey, no run fullish on off stump and Davey looked to push it down the ground. Straightened off the pitch and he ended up popping it in the air off the inside half of the ball, falls just short of the diving Clarke at short midwicket
Faulkner to Davey, no run length ball, angling across, defended towards point
Faulkner to Davey, no run another bouncer, Davey ducks again
Faulkner to Davey, no run back of a length on middle and leg. Can't connect with the flick and the ball hits him on the thigh pad
Faulkner to Davey, 3 runs slower ball, full and wide, comes forward and eases it into the gap at cover point

Johnson to Coleman, 1 wide you'd say that's a good bouncer from Johnson if this was Test cricket. He had to pull his hands away from the ball in a hurry. But it was just a fraction down the leg side, and umpires can be merciless sometimes

Johnson to Coleman, OUT Johnson gets into the party now. Back of a length, fourth-stump, angling away. No footwork in that attempted back-foot punch, and Clarke dives to his right from second slip to grab the edge, lovely low catch
Johnson to Berrington, no run shortish ball, angling across Berrington. He leaves it alone, keeping his bat well inside the line
Johnson to Berrington, no run this is another well-directed short ball, rising to chest height on middle and leg stump. Jumps to ride the bounce and plays it down into the off side with soft hands
Johnson to Berrington, no run back of a length on middle and leg, tucked away towards short midwicket
Johnson to Berrington, no run back of a length close to off stump. Trusts the angle and lets it go
Johnson to Berrington, 1 run another discomfiting short ball. Rising steeply towards the batsman's throat. He jumps in the air again, and manages to squeeze it away towards third man, keeping it down

Maxwell to Berrington, OUT and he strikes first ball, with a fairly rubbish ball. It's floated up outside off, it's a half-volley, and Berrington slices his drive in the air, straight to Warner at cover
Maxwell to Cross, no run tossed up on off stump, blocked into the off side
Maxwell to Cross, no run once again it's floated across the batsman, wide outside off. Goes for the big drive and doesn't connect
Maxwell to Cross, no run length ball on middle stump, Cross blocks it back towards the bowler
Maxwell to Cross, 4 wide back of a length, turning down the leg side. Cross can't connect with the flick, the unsighted Haddin can't collect behind the stumps
Maxwell to Machan, no run full-toss on off stump, blocked to short midwicket
Maxwell to Machan, 2 runs tossed up outside off, driven to the left of sweeper cover
Cummins to Davey, no run back of a length outside off, punched to mid-off
Cummins to Davey, no run full on middle stump, clipped away towards square leg
Cummins to Davey, no run length ball close to off stump, blocked to mid-off
Cummins to Davey, no run short ball, angling into the body. Fends at it and pops it in the air, but drops his bottom hand and it falls a short distance away from the batsman, into the off side
Cummins to Davey, 1 run back of a length, angling into off and middle, tucked away towards deep backward square leg
Cummins to Leask, FOUR runs length ball on off stump, and Leask creates room for himself once again, and simply slaps it back down the ground, between bowler and mid-off
Starc to Davey, no run back of a length, angling in towards off stump. Davey is back and across to defend
Starc to Davey, OUT clatter. Off-stump yorker, and Davey is late bringing his bat down. It actually straightened a touch and went past the outside edge
Starc to Wardlaw, no run another yorker, outside off, this time. Wardlaw backs away, looks to poke it away through point, can't connect

Starc to Wardlaw, OUT boom, and that off stump takes another beating. It's full and fast and Wardlaw gave himself room to play through the off side, bat was nowhere near it in the end. Again it straightened off the pitch

4.57pm Australia have completed the first half of their task quickly, having sent Scotland in because of the threat of rain. Will they change their batting order around in pursuit of 131? We will see soon.
5.05pm Who's opening? Warner? Maxwell? Haddin? Nope. It's Michael Clarke and Aaron Finch.
Wardlaw to Clarke, 1 run short ball, angling into the body. Clarke takes his eyes off it, looking to fend it away, hits his gloves and pops into the leg side
Wardlaw to Finch, 1 run fuller now, pushed away to the right of mid-on
Wardlaw to Clarke, no run back of a length outside off, punched to short cover
Wardlaw to Clarke, no run back of a length outside off, dabbed towards backward point
Wardlaw to Clarke, FOUR runs another short ball, this time Clarke pulls it away from outside off, down to the deep square leg boundary
Wardlaw to Clarke, no run full, a bit of shape away towards off stump. Clarke was initially looking to clip it into the leg side, but adjusted to push it with a straight bat into the covers

Taylor to Finch, 1 run dropped. It was on a good length, angling across Finch, and if he has a weakness it's that he shuffles rather than move forward or back. Poked at it and edged thickly, to the left of second slip. Mommsen got his hands to it on the dive, couldn't hold on
Taylor to Clarke, no run a bit of inswing now. Clarke was looking to work it into the leg side, missed it, and it crashed into his groin region
Taylor to Clarke, no run length ball outside off, Clarke gets a lovely stride out to drive towards mid-off. Machan dives to his left to make a good stop
Taylor to Clarke, no run length ball outside off, left alone

Taylor to Clarke, no run whoa. That shaped away late to accentuate the angle, and started very tight on off stump, on a length that left Clarke's feet rooted to the crease. Poked at it, the ball beat his outside edge, and his feet walked into the shot after the ball had passed him
Taylor to Clarke, no run a bit wider and Clarke leaves it alone
Wardlaw to Finch, FOUR runs too straight, and Finch clips it away off his pads, strikes it crisply through midwicket

Wardlaw to Finch, SIX runs short ball, and that sat up and gave Finch all the time in the world to rock back and swivel through a powerful, flat pull that carried all the way over the forward square leg boundary
Wardlaw to Finch, no run length ball outside off, left alone
Wardlaw to Finch, no run length ball outside off, driven on the up to cover. Didn't time it as well as he would have liked

Wardlaw to Finch, FOUR runs full outside off and Finch climbs into that drive, hits it in the air, but it travels like a rocket to the right of mid-off, who dives full-length but can't pluck it out of the air
Wardlaw to Finch, no run back of a length, angling into the body. Finch jumps across to whip it through the leg side, is hit on the thigh pad
Taylor to Clarke, no run length ball on off stump, nice stride forward to defend
Taylor to Clarke, FOUR runs full and wide and Clarke welcomes the opportunity to press forward and caress the ball to the left of mid-off
Taylor to Clarke, no run back of a length outside off, dabbed to backward point
Taylor to Clarke, 1 run short outside off, throws his bat at the cut, edges it thickly and it flies past the diving second slip fielder, down to third man
Taylor to Finch, FOUR runs full and wide and Finch doesn't mind driving in the air, finds the gap to the left of cover point

Taylor to Finch, OUT gone! Another drive in the air, but this time he's hit it too close to cover, who takes it well, low, in both hands, diving forward. Taylor did well to bowl it full again, but not as wide as the previous ball, and Finch pushed hard at it, way out in front of his body

Wardlaw to Clarke, SIX runs another short ball from Wardlaw, and Clarke doesn't control that pull at all. It comes on quicker than he expects and it's more of a short-arm jab than anything, top-edges it and it carries all the way over the long leg fielder
Wardlaw to Clarke, 1 wide another bouncer, climbs too high for Clarke to bother ducking or swaying
Wardlaw to Clarke, FOUR runs short and wide and Clarke gets up on his toes to cut it away to the point boundary
Wardlaw to Clarke, no run length ball on off stump, blocked towards short midwicket
Wardlaw to Clarke, no run back of a length, too close to off stump to punch too firmly, ends up hitting with a modest amount of power towards extra cover
Wardlaw to Clarke, no run fuller now, angling into middle stump, blocked to mid-on
Wardlaw to Clarke, no run dug in short outside off, left alone
Taylor to Watson, no run length ball outside off, presses forward and blocks to short cover
Taylor to Watson, no run back of a length outside off, chopped towards point
Taylor to Watson, no run a bit fuller and wider and that's a big stride forward to drive to cover
Taylor to Watson, no run fullish outside off, driven to mid-off
Taylor to Watson, no run full again, Watson comes forward and pokes it away towards point
Taylor to Watson, 1 run back of a length on middle stump, tucked away to the right of mid-off
Davey to Watson, 1 run back of a length, angling into middle stump, worked away through square leg
Davey to Clarke, no run length ball on off stump, blocked into the covers
Davey to Clarke, 1 run drifts into the pads, flicked away to long leg
Davey to Watson, no run back of a length outside off, punched to cover point
Davey to Watson, 1 run a touch too straight again, clipped to deep backward square leg
Davey to Clarke, no run length ball outside off, doesn't come on for the flat-bat slap. Inside-edges it into his pads
Taylor to Watson, 1 run shortish outside off, cut away to the right of third man
Taylor to Clarke, no run back of a length on off stump, punched to straight midwicket
Taylor to Clarke, FOUR runs length ball on off stump, punches it down the ground, was in the air for a bit, but just wide of the bowler, diving to his right in his follow-through
Taylor to Clarke, no run fullish on middle stump, blocked to straight midwicket
Taylor to Clarke, 1 run back of a length on middle and leg, tucked away to deep square leg
Taylor to Watson, FOUR runs full on off stump, and Watson makes a lot of room, exposing all his stums, and powers it back down the ground, between the non-striker and mid-off
Davey to Clarke, no run short ball, doesn't get up as high as Clarke expected. Was through his pull a touch too early and it smacked him on the inside of the right thigh
Davey to Clarke, no run back of a length on off stump, defended to short cover
Davey to Clarke, no run length ball outside off, driven to mid-off
Davey to Clarke, no run fullish on middle stump, held it back a bit, defended to mid-on
Davey to Clarke, no run back of a length on off stump, punched towards mid-off
Davey to Clarke, no run full and wide, slap and a miss from Clarke
Taylor to Watson, FOUR runs full-toss outside off. Watson makes himself a bit of room and slapped it away through square cover
Taylor to Watson, no run again he tries to make room. Follows him with a full ball. Looks for the drive again, can only inside-edge into his pad
Taylor to Watson, no run once again exposes his stumps. Bowls in the blockhole on middle stump, jabs it away to short cover

Taylor to Watson, no run now Watson goes the other way, shuffling across. Taylor reads his intentions and slants it away, slower ball. Watson looks to whip it through the leg side, it rolls off the leading edge into the covers
Taylor to Watson, FOUR runs boom. Now he moves towards the leg side and Taylor bowls a length ball on off stump. Enough swinging room for Watson to club it down the ground, between bowler and mid-on
Taylor to Watson, no run full outside off, driven to mid-off
Davey to Clarke, no run full on off stump, defended to mid-on
Davey to Clarke, FOUR runs shortish outside off. Sits up and Clarke pulls it away to the right of mid-on
Davey to Clarke, no run fullish outside off, defended to mid-off
Davey to Clarke, FOUR runs shortish, not too much width, but Clarke didn't need a lot. Stayed inside the line and chopped it away through point
Davey to Clarke, no run length ball outside off, swings away after Clarke leaves it

Davey to Clarke, no run slower bouncer. Clarke was through his pull too quick, checked his shot three-quarters of the way through, and it hit him on the right side of his body and rolled towards the slips
Wardlaw to Watson, 1 run full on middle stump, clipped to deep midwicket
Wardlaw to Clarke, SIX runs full outside off, and Clarke has a merry swing at it, with a whippy finish to launch it over the long-on boundary
Wardlaw to Clarke, no run back of a length, angling in towards off stump, stabbed away towards point
Wardlaw to Clarke, 1 run full on the pads, clipped to deep square leg
Wardlaw to Watson, no run short slower ball outside off. Watson backs away from the stumps and clubs it to mid-on
Wardlaw to Watson, 2 runs full outside off, makes room and scoops it high in the air, gets more distance than elevation, stops three-fourths of the way to the wide long-off boundary
Davey to Clarke, 1 run short on off stump, pulled round to deep backward square leg
Davey to Watson, 1 run sees Watson making room and bowls a short slower ball outside off. Waits on it and slaps it to sweeper cover
Davey to Clarke, no run length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
Davey to Clarke, 1 run short and wide, slapped to sweeper cover
Davey to Watson, FOUR runs fullish slower ball on off stump, Watson clears his front leg and mows it down the ground, two bounces and into the long-on boundary cushions
Wardlaw to Clarke, FOUR runs short ball, sits up outside off, and Clarke loves those, pulls it away witheringly to the straight midwicket boundary

Wardlaw to Clarke, OUT taken! That's brilliant from Leask at the deep square leg boundary. It was short again, angling into the body, and Clarke pulled it in the air, to the fielder's right. Sprints quickly across, and throws himself across to come up with the ball in his right hand
Wardlaw to Warner, SIX runs full and wide and Warner smokes his first ball for six, doesn't even have to move, just sinks to his knees and launches it a long way over the long-off boundary
Wardlaw to Warner, FOUR runs back of a length on off stump, and Warner just whips it away to the wide long-on boundary

Wardlaw to Warner, 1 run short on leg stump and Warner miscues his pull way up in the air, but it drops down into no-man's land, a long way out of the reach of deep square leg running in from the rope
Wardlaw to Faulkner, 1 run full on leg stump, Faulkner clears his front leg and swipes it to long leg

Davey to Faulkner, FOUR runs down the track, and he gets a shortish slower ball. Has all the time in the world to adjust his feet, find a stable base, and simply club it down the ground, to the right of mid-off
Davey to Faulkner, FOUR runs makes room now, exposes all his stumps, and slaps a fullish off-stump ball over cover
Davey to Faulkner, 1 run full and wide, and this time he slices it in the air, on the bounce to the man at sweeper cover
Davey to Warner, 1 wide full and wide, too wide, slants it quite perceptibly beyond the tramline outside off
Davey to Warner, SIX runs full-toss outside off, and he opens his hips up to slug that away over the straight midwicket boundary
Davey to Warner, FOUR runs low full-toss on off stump, and he clears his front leg and swipes it away into the leg side. Machan, sliding to his left from long-on, makes an absolute mess of it
Davey to Warner, no run yorker on off stump, Warner can only poke it back to the bowler
Leask to Faulkner, 2 leg byes length ball down the leg side. Looks for the sweep, misses, rolls off his pad towards fine leg
Leask to Faulkner, 1 wide fired down the leg side again, too wide for Faulkner to connect with the sweep
Leask to Faulkner, SIX runs full and wide and Faulkner finishes with a six, slog-swept over the midwicket boundary, seconds before Dhoni finishes with a six in Auckland

7.45pm Rain kept everyone on their toes in what was otherwise one of the most one-sided matches of this World Cup. At the end of it, Australia seal second place in Group A. Scotland end their third World Cup still searching for their first win.
8.00pm That's all from us for this game. Do tune in for tomorrow's matches and the rest of the World Cup too, and keep sending in your comments. Until next time, good night!
Australia won by 7 wickets (with 208 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Mitchell Starc, AUS
